result.execSummary:
The defendant Mikael C. Paschal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mikael C. Paschal is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mikael C. Paschal was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to revocation in 12CF763 & 13CF162.
Credit for 126 days, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include:  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay fine of $300 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement

ADA Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Matthew Perz.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  3:49pm-  Matter heard with 12CF763 & 13CF162.  State dismisses places enhancer on count 1.  Matter is resolved.  Defendant admits to prior convictions.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 1; found guilty by the court.  On the motion of the State, counts 2 & 3 are dismissed.  Parties waive PSI.  Court proceedings to sentencing.  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 18 months w/conditions - consecutive to revocation in 12CF763 & 13CF162.  126 days sentence credit if revoked.  Court orders $300.00 fine plus costs, drug surcharge & DNA surcharge.  DE to submit DNA sample (unless previously done).  Appeal rights given.
Final pre-trial on September 30, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Attorney Perz is requesting 9/19/2014 Final pre-trial be rescheduled as he is not available.  Final pre-trial is rescheduled to 9/30/2014 at 2:30pm.  NTBS by the Court.
Final pre-trial on September 19, 2014 at 09:00 am.
